meanings.definition: Capable of being included within a larger category or group.
meanings.sent1: The small fish was subsumable into the category of marine animals.
meanings.sent2: Her idea was easily subsumable under the broader concept of creativity.
meanings.sent3: The tiny pebble felt subsumable among the giant boulders.
meanings.sent4: His unique style was subsumable into the rich tapestry of art history.
meanings.sent5: The colorful feather was so subsumable that it blended seamlessly with the other decorations.

meanings.definition: Able to be encompassed or absorbed within something else.
meanings.sent1: The new data was subsumable into the existing report.
meanings.sent2: Her thoughts were easily subsumable within the context of the conversation.
meanings.sent3: The small village was subsumable within the bustling city.
meanings.sent4: His voice was subsumable into the harmony of the choir.
meanings.sent5: The sweet aroma was so subsumable that it filled the entire room.
